'''Clive Mantle''' (born 3 June 1957) is a British actor. He was a chorister at St. John's College Choir in Cambridge for four years before joining [[wikipedia:RADA|RADA]]. He won the [[wikipedia:Laurence Olivier Award|Laurence Olivier Award]] for Most Promising Newcomer in 1986 for a stage performance of ''[[wikipedia:Of Mice and Men|Of Mice and Men]]''.

In 1984 he became very well-known to British audiences when he was cast as [[wikipedia:Little John|Little John]] in the cult TV series ''[[wikipedia:Robin of Sherwood|Robin of Sherwood]]'', a fantastical take on the [[wikipedia:Robin Hood|Robin Hood]] legend. He subsequently played the role of surgeon Mike Barrett over nine years, first in ''[[wikipedia:Casualty (TV series)|Casualty]]'' and then its spin-off ''[[wikipedia:Holby City|Holby City]]''. He also had a brief recurring role on the sitcom ''[[wikipedia:The Vicar of Dibley|The Vicar of Dibley]]'' and a small role in the film ''[[wikipedia:Alien 3|Alien 3]]''.

In ''[[Game of Thrones]]'' he plays the role of Lord [[Jon Umber|Greatjon Umber]] and was confirmed in the role on 20 August 2010.

Mantle was unable to return to the series for [[Season 2]] due to having been cast on another TV show. He was not asked to return for the [[Season 3|third season]]. It is unclear if the Greatjon will be written out (potentially allowing Mantle to return in later seasons) or recast.<ref>[http://winteriscoming.net/2012/07/filming-on-season-three-begins-today/#comment-200823 Winter is Coming]</ref>
